DOC.brief_summary: Objective registry study compare strategy complete vs. target lesion-only primary PCI ( percutaneous coronary intervention ) IRA ( infarct relate artery ) STEMI ( ST elevation myocardial infarction ) patient .
DOC.brief_title: Complete Infarct Related Artery Revascularization Acute Myocardial Infarction
DOC.detailed_description: CORAMI registry study address issue complete vs culprit-only PCI within infarct related artery patient ST-elevation non-ST elevation myocardial infarction treat interventional procedure . The main objective study include : 1. gathering data patient least two independent critical stenotic lesion IRA ( one culprit lesion ) index primary PCI STEMI NSTEMI ( prevalence , characteristic , predispose factor ) . 2. compare choose treatment strategy multiple lesion IRA 3. comparison complete vs. target lesion-only PCI IRA acute MI ( myocardial infarction ) patient . The study clinical hypothesis stenting single critical - culprit lesion multi-lesion IRA MI patient index PCI procedure superior stenting critical lesion IRA term early treatment result might associate less frequent periprocedural angiographic complication . H0 : The efficacy term early treatment result stenting one critical - culprit lesion multilesions IRA acute MI patient less equal efficacy stenting critical lesion IRA . H1 : The efficacy term early treatment result stenting one critical - culprit lesion multilesions IRA acute MI patient great efficacy stenting critical lesion IRA . CORAMI Registry prospective , international ( Poland , Slovenia ) , multicenter observational study retrospective chart review perform experienced invasive facility centre 24/7 PCI duty continuous patient enrollment 18 month ( January 2011 - June 2012 ) . This study collect data consecutive patient STEMI NSTEMI undergo immediate coronary angiography demonstrate least two independent ( require two stent platform ) critical lesion infarct relate artery ( one consider target/culprit lesion cause myocardial infarction require immediate PCI ) . Patients treat ( multiple single lesion stenting ) accord local standard operator 's decision . Patient follow phone call and/or visit ( accord local protocol ) perform 12 month enrollment applicable local standard .
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis STEMI NSTEMI ( accord ESC 2007 definition ) Over 18 year age Presence two critical lesion require PCI IRA ( LAD ( leave anterior descend ) , Cx ( circumflex ) , RCA ( right coronary artery ) ) : 1 . Target/culprit lesion require immediate stenting ( > 50 100 % ) 2 . Second critical lesion ( 7090 % ) . Terminal illness life expectancy less < 1 year active cancer disease , Pregnancy possibility pregnancy Second critical lesion IRA > 90 % occlusion Contraindications PCI or/and stent implantation Concurrent participation another clinical study meet primary endpoint
